document.docAuthor: Monné, Miguel A. & Monné, Marcela L.
document.masterDocTitle: Synopsis of the genus Colobothea Lepeletier & Audinet-Serville in Bolivia, with descriptions of two new species and new country records (Coleoptera, Cerambycidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Synopsis of the genus Colobothea Lepeletier & Audinet-Serville in Bolivia, with descriptions of two new species and new country records (Coleoptera, Cerambycidae)

heading.emphasis:
Key to the Bolivian species of
Colobothea

paragraph.keyLead: 1 . Pronotum predominantly black, in dorsal view with two longitudinal stripes of white pubescence ........................... 2

2 . Vertex with a single longitudinal stripe of white pubescence (
Fig. 1
).
.............................. C. sublunulata
Zajciw, 1962

3 . Basal ¾ of the elytra with two stripes of white pubescence, the dorsal one larger and parallel to the suture, and the lateral one very straight and situated on the epipleura (
Fig. 2
).
............................................... C. lunulata
Lucas, 1857

5 . Pronotum with six longitudinal stripes of yellowish pubescence, the outer stripes connected on the anterior margin (
Fig. 4
)
................................................................................................................................ C. sordida
Aurivillius, 1902
- Pronotum with four, six, or seven longitudinal stripes of white pubescence ............................................................... 6
6 . Vertex with a single longitudinal stripe of white or yellowish pubescence.................................................................. 7
- Vertex with two stripes of white pubescence, diverging posteriorly .......................................................................... 11
- Pronotum with four or six longitudinal stripes of white pubescence, without a middle stripe .................................... 8

8 . Antenna of the male with an obtuse spine at the apex of antennomere VI; elytral pubescence dense, predominantly whitish-gray, with three large spots of black pubescence (
Fig. 6
) .............................................
C. brullei
Gahan, 1889

9 . Pronotum with four stripes; humeri oblique; yellowish pubescence of the elytra dense, with three spots of black pubescence (
Fig. 7
)
............................................................................................................... C. hirtipes
(
Degeer, 1775
)
11 . Sides of the prothorax with a minute tubercle near the posterior margin................................................................... 12

12 . Pronotum with straight longitudinal white stripes; in male apex of the fifth urosternite projected in large latero-ven- tral lobe (
Fig. 10
)
.................................................................................................... C. appendiculata
Aurivillius, 1902

- Pronotum with curved longitudinal stripes; in male, apex of the fifth urosternite without lateral lobes (
Fig. 11
)......... ...........................................................................................................................................
C. plebeja
Aurivillius, 1902

13 . Sides of the prothorax regularly rounded; each elytron has three spots of black pubescence with irregular margins (
Fig. 12
)...........................................................................................................................
C. meleagrina
Erichson, 1847

- Sides of the prothorax diverging posteriorly; each elytron has three spots of black pubescence, all clearly defined, mainly the middle one (
Fig. 13
)
....................................................................................................... C. berkovi
sp. nov.
14 . Pronotum with large median macula of velvety black pubescence, with rounded and regular sides......................... 15

15 . Prothorax with lateral post-median tubercle well developed (
Fig. 14
)
............................ C. assimilis
Aurivillius, 1902
- Prothorax with a minute dorso-lateral tubercle near the posterior margin ................................................................. 16

- Vertex with two stripes of pubescence, diverging posteriorly; elytra without black spots post-scutellum (
Fig. 16
) .....
........................................................................................................................................... C. macularis
(
Olivier, 1792
)
18 . Pronotum with a narrow median longitudinal stripe of black pubescence ................................................................. 19
- Pronotum uniformly covered with maculae of brown, grayish, and orange pubescence ............................................. 2
19 . Vertex with two lines of orange pubescence diverging posteriorly. ........................................................................... 20

20 . Lateral tubercle of the prothorax well developed; elytral pubescence predominantly grayish; male with fifth uroster- nite without lateral carina (
Fig. 18
)
....................................................................................... C. varia
(
Fabricius, 1787
)

- Lateral tubercle of the prothorax reduced; elytral pubescence predominantly yellow and orange; male with fifth uro- sternite provided with an acute lateral carina (
Fig. 19
)................................................................
C. pictilis
Bates, 1865

21 . Vertex with two lines of orange pubescence diverging posteriorly (
Fig. 20
)
.................. C. simillima
Aurivillius, 1902

23 . Yellow lateral stripe of the pronotum projected posteriorly on the basal ¼ or 1 / 3 of the elytron; humeri projected, metasternum with a more or less developed patch of yellow pubescence (
Fig. 23
)
.......... C. declivis
Aurivillius, 1902

- Yellow lateral stripe of the pronotum not projected on the elytron, or projected by a minute patch; humeri oblique, metasternum without patches of yellow pubescence (
Fig. 24
) .....................................................
C. wappesi
sp. nov.
